item.description: ğŸš„ë¬¸ì œ ë§í¬ https://www.acmicpc.net/problem/10867 ğŸ“–ë¬¸ì œ ë‚´ìš© ë¬¸ì œ Nê°œì˜ ì •ìˆ˜ê°€ ì£¼ì–´ì§„ë‹¤. ì´ë•Œ, Nâ€¦
item.content:encoded:
ğŸš„ë¬¸ì œ ë§í¬

https://www.acmicpc.net/problem/10867

ğŸ“–ë¬¸ì œ ë‚´ìš©

ë¬¸ì œ

Nê°œì˜ ì •ìˆ˜ê°€ ì£¼ì–´ì§„ë‹¤. ì´ë•Œ, Nê°œì˜ ì •ìˆ˜ë¥¼ ì˜¤ë¦„ì°¨ìˆœìœ¼ë¡œ ì •ë ¬í•˜ëŠ” í”„ë¡œê·¸ë¨ì„ ì‘ì„±í•˜ì‹œì˜¤. ê°™ì€ ì •ìˆ˜ëŠ” í•œ ë²ˆë§Œ ì¶œë ¥í•œë‹¤.

ì…ë ¥

ì²«ì§¸ ì¤„ì— ìˆ˜ì˜ ê°œìˆ˜ N (1 â‰¤ N â‰¤ 100,000)ì´ ì£¼ì–´ì§„ë‹¤. ë‘˜ì§¸ì—ëŠ” ìˆ«ìê°€ ì£¼ì–´ì§„ë‹¤. ì´ ìˆ˜ëŠ” ì ˆëŒ“ê°’ì´ 1,000ë³´ë‹¤ ì‘ê±°ë‚˜ ê°™ì€ ì •ìˆ˜ì´ë‹¤.

ì¶œë ¥

ì²«ì§¸ ì¤„ì— ìˆ˜ë¥¼ ì˜¤ë¦„ì°¨ìˆœìœ¼ë¡œ ì •ë ¬í•œ ê²°ê³¼ë¥¼ ì¶œë ¥í•œë‹¤. ì´ë•Œ, ê°™ì€ ìˆ˜ëŠ” í•œ ë²ˆë§Œ ì¶œë ¥í•œë‹¤.

ì˜ˆì œ

ì˜ˆì œ ì…ë ¥

10 1 4 2 3 1 4 2 3 1 2

ì˜ˆì œ ì¶œë ¥

1 2 3 4

ğŸ˜ì œì¶œ ì½”ë“œ

#include <stdio.h>
#include <stdlib.h>

void init_array(int* arr, int arr_size);
void print_array(int* arr, int arr_size);
void deduplicate_array(int* arr, int *arr_size);
int is_include(int *arr, int arr_size, int value);
void sort(int* arr, int arr_size);

int main(void){
    int arr_size;          
    scanf("%d", &arr_size); // ë°°ì—´ í¬ê¸°ë¥¼ ë¬»ëŠ”ë‹¤
    
    int arr[arr_size];    
    init_array(arr, arr_size); // ë°°ì—´ ì´ˆê¸°í™”
    
    deduplicate_array(arr, &arr_size); // ë°°ì—´ ì¤‘ë³µ ì œê±°
    
    sort(arr, arr_size); // ë°°ì—´ ì •ë ¬
    print_array(arr, arr_size); // ë°°ì—´ ì¶œë ¥
}

void init_array(int* arr, int arr_size) {
    for(int i = 0; i < arr_size; i++) {
        scanf("%d", &arr[i]);
    }   
}

void print_array(int* arr, int arr_size){
    for(int i = 0; i < arr_size; i++)
		printf("%d ", arr[i]);
	printf("\n");
	
}

void deduplicate_array(int* arr, int *arr_size){
    int* temp = malloc(sizeof(int) * *arr_size);
    int count = 0;    
    
    for(int i = 0; i < *arr_size; i++) {
        if(is_include(temp, count, arr[i]) == 0) {
            temp[count++] = arr[i];            
        } // ë§Œì•½ tempê°€ arrì˜ ê°’ì„ ê°€ì§€ê³  ìˆì§€ ì•Šë‹¤ë©´ ì¶”ê°€
    }
    
    for(int j = 0; j < count; j++) {
        arr[j] = temp[j];
    } // arrì— temp ê°’ì„ ë³µì‚¬
    
    *arr_size = count; // ë°°ì—´ ë’·ë¶€ë¶„ì€ ë²„ë¦¬ê¸° ìœ„í•´
    
    free(temp);
}

int is_include(int *arr, int arr_size, int value) { // ë°°ì—´ì´ ê°’ì„ í¬í•¨í•˜ê³  ìˆëŠ”ì§€ í™•ì¸
    
    for(int i = 0; i < arr_size; i++) {
        if(arr[i] == value) {
            return 1;
        }
    }
    
    return 0;
}

void sort(int* arr, int arr_size){	// ë²„ë¸” ì†ŒíŠ¸ + ì¤‘ë‹¨ì 
    int temp;    
    int count = 0; // ì¤‘ë‹¨ì  í”Œë˜ê·¸
    for(int i = 0; i < arr_size; i++) {  
        count = 0;
        for(int j = 0; j < arr_size - 1; j++) {
            if(*(arr + j) > *(arr + j + 1)){
                temp = *(arr + j);
                *(arr + j) = *(arr + j + 1);
                *(arr + j + 1) = temp;
                count++;                
            }            
        }
     if(count == 0) break; 
    }    
}

ì„¤ëª…

ìƒë‹¹íˆ ì •ì„ì ì¸ ë°©ë²•ìœ¼ë¡œ ì ‘ê·¼í•˜ì˜€ë‹¤. ìˆœì„œëŠ” ë°°ì—´ì˜ 1. ì¤‘ë³µì„ ì œê±°í•œ ë’¤ 2. ì •ë ¬í•˜ê¸° ë¡œ ì„ íƒí–ˆë‹¤. ì¤‘ë³µì„ ì œê±°í•˜ì—¬ ìµœëŒ€í•œ ì •ë ¬í•  ë°°ì—´ì˜ í¬ê¸°ë¥¼ ì¤„ì—¬ ì‹œê°„ì„ ì¤„ì´ê¸° ìœ„í•´ì„œì´ë‹¤.

ì¤‘ë³µ ì œê±°ì˜ ë°©ë²• ë˜í•œ ì •ì„ìœ¼ë¡œ, ì‹¬í”Œí•˜ë‹¤. ë°°ì—´ì„ ëŒë©´ì„œ ì•„ì´í…œì„ ì¶”ê°€í•˜ê³ , is_include(...) í•¨ìˆ˜ë¡œ ì´ë¯¸ ë„£ì—ˆëŠ”ì§€ í™•ì¸í•˜ì—¬ ì¶”ê°€ë¥¼ ê²°ì •í•œë‹¤.

ì •ë ¬í•˜ê¸°ëŠ” ë‚´ê°€ ì¢‹ì•„í•˜ëŠ” ë²„ë¸” ì •ë ¬ì„ ì‚¬ìš©í•˜ì˜€ë‹¤.êµ¬í˜„ì´ ì‰¬ì›Œì„œ ì‹œê°„ì´ ì¡°ê¸ˆ ê±¸ë¦¬ì§€ë§Œ, ì¡°ê¸ˆì´ë¼ë„ ì¤„ì—¬ë³´ê³ ì ì¤‘ë‹¨ì (count ë³€ìˆ˜)ì„ êµ¬í˜„í–ˆë‹¤.

ì‚¬ì‹¤ Cì–¸ì–´ë¥¼ ì‚¬ìš©í•´ì„œ ê·¸ë ‡ì§€, jsë‚˜ pythonì´ì—ˆìœ¼ë©´ Setë¡œ ë§Œë“¤ê³  sort() í•¨ìˆ˜ë§Œ í˜¸ì¶œí•˜ë©´â€¦ ìµœì†Œ í•œ ì¤„ì— ëë‚  ì¼ì´ë‹¤.

ë˜í•œ ì´ëŸ¬í•œ ë°©ë²• ë§ê³ ë„, í•´ì‹œ í…Œì´ë¸”ì„ ë§Œë“œëŠ” ë°©ë²•ë„ ìˆëŠ”ë°, ê·¸ê±´ 2í¸ì—ì„œ ì°¾ì•„ëµ™ê³ ì í•œë‹¤.

item.title: Quick Start
item.description: Getting Started ğŸ˜ 1. Create a Gatsby site. If you are not using , following Gatsby Getting Started 2. Start developing. 3. Add your contentâ€¦
item.content:encoded:
Getting Started ğŸ˜

1. Create a Gatsby site.

# create a new Gatsby site using the blog starter
$ npx gatsby new my-blog-starter https://github.com/JaeYeopHan/gatsby-starter-bee

If you are not using npx, following Gatsby Getting Started

$ npm install -g gatsby-cli
$ gatsby new my-blog-starter https://github.com/JaeYeopHan/gatsby-starter-bee

2. Start developing.

$ cd my-blog-starter/
$ npm start
# open localhost:8000

3. Add your content

You can writeâ€¦

  • contents to blog in content/blog directory.
  • resume content/__about directory.

With markdown syntax and some meta data

Support script for creating new post

$ npm run post

4. Fix meta data

You can fix meta data of blog in /gatsby-meta-config.js file.

5. Publish with netlify

ğŸ’¡ if you want to deploy github pages, add following script to package.json

"scripts": {
    "deploy": "gatsby build && gh-pages -d public -b master -r 'git@github.com:${your github id}/${github page name}.github.io.git'"
}

:memo: Write a post!

content
â”œâ”€â”€ __about
â””â”€â”€ blog
  • You can register your resume on the web. (in __about directory)
  • You can register your post. (in blog directory)

ğŸ§ Customize!

Gatsby config

/root
â”œâ”€â”€ gatsby-browser.js // font, polyfill, onClientRender ...
â”œâ”€â”€ gatsby-config.js // Gatsby config
â”œâ”€â”€ gatsby-meta-config.js // Template meta config
â””â”€â”€ gatsby-node.js // Gatsby Node config

Structure

src
â”œâ”€â”€ components // Just component with styling
â”œâ”€â”€ layout // home, post layout
â”œâ”€â”€ pages // routing except post: /(home), /about
â”œâ”€â”€ styles
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ code.scss
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ dark-theme.scss
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ light-theme.scss
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ variables.scss
â””â”€â”€ templates
    â”œâ”€â”€ blog-post.js
    â””â”€â”€ home.js

Style

You can customize color in src/styles directory.

src/styles
â”œâ”€â”€ code.scss
â”œâ”€â”€ dark-theme.scss
â”œâ”€â”€ light-theme.scss
â””â”€â”€ variables.scss

Welcome to gatsby-starter-bee! Happy blogging! ğŸ‘»

item.title: Welcome Bee starter
item.description: Welcome, Gatsby! This starter is full-package for your new blog! 1. Support Four frontmatter title date category draft 2. Code highlightingâ€¦
item.content:encoded:
Welcome, Gatsby! This starter is full-package for your new blog!

1. Support Four frontmatter

---
title: 'Welcome Bee starter'
date: 2019-2-6 16:21:13
category: 'development'
draft: false
---
  1. title
  2. date
  3. category
  4. draft

2. Code highlighting

  1. With Fira Code font
  2. Support highlighting with prism 2-1. Use inline highlighting
import React from 'react'

const TEMPLATE = 'gatsby-starter-bee'
class Foo extends React.Component {
  handleClick = val => {
    if (val === 'bar') {
      return 1
    } else if (val !== 'zoo') {
      return 2
    }
    console.log(`clicked`)
    return 3
  }

  render() {
    return <div>Welcome, Gatsby, ${TEMPLATE}</div>
  }
}

code

3. Support Markdown (h2)

  1. With Noto Sans font
  2. Support header anchoring

h3

h4

h5

quote!

bold italic

4. Support emoji ğŸš€

Based on emojione ğŸ™

5. Support light/dark mode

6. Support social sharing feature

  1. Twitter
  2. Facebook

Bonus, Buy me a coffee button

Set, buyMeACoffeeId of gatsby-meta-config.js

7. Comments feature

You can add comments feature by selecting one of them.

  • Disqus
  • utterances

8. Support latex

Support latex rendering with katex plugin.

$$\prod_{i=a}^{b} f(i)$$

âˆi=abf(i)\prod_{i=a}^{b} f(i)âˆi=abâ€‹f(i)

9. Other features of this template

  1. You can add resume to /about
  2. Lazy rendering
  3. Scroll restoration
  4. Categorize posts
  5. Offline caching with service worker (based gatsby)
  6. Support GA(Google Analytics)

Letâ€™s Start! Go
